bYBSAx-w6.memHandModelNotes: Not common in dense forests. Needs open forests and woodlands with many dead trees.  However, the only quantitative study of the subspp. In the Appalachians only searched for territories in open hardwood forests, so no data exist on whether pine or mixed types are used in the Appalachians

references.B97NIC01NCGP: Nicholson CP. 1997. Atlas of the breeding birds of Tennessee. Knoxville: University of Tennessee Press.
references.B83AOU01USGP: American Ornithologists' Union (AOU). 1983. Check-list of North American Birds, 6th edition. Allen Press, Inc., Lawrence, Kansas. 877 pp.
references.B94STE01NAUS: Stevenson, H. M., and B. H. Anderson. 1994. The birdlife of Florida. University Press of Florida, Gainesville. 892 pp.
references.B88MIT01NAUS: Mitchell, W.A. 1988. Songbird nest boxes. Section 5.1.8, U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Wildlife Resources Management Manual. Tech. Rep. EL-88-19. Waterways Experiment Station, Vicksburg, Mississippi. 48 pp.
references.W02WAL01USGP: Walters, Eric L., Edward H. Miller and Peter E. Lowther. 2002. Yellow-bellied Sapsucker (Sphyrapicus varius), The Birds of North America Online (A. Poole, Ed.).
